cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles east of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking generally west–north-west today, turning west tonight, aiming for the south-central Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi, Matagorda, Freeport and the upper-Texas barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds at 25–35 mph Friday night into Saturday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤8 % chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft above normal tides possible on the upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay, producing elevated water levels around the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, leading to ponding on dock surfaces and potential flash flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Gulf-facing beaches; reduced visibility and squalls could disrupt vessel movement.
